name: Olin Cup
overview:
The Olin Cup competition was founded in 1988 as part of The Hatchery entrepreneurship course at the Olin School of Business.

The competition began awarding up to $70,000 in seed funding in 2001 with the support of the Skandalaris family. In 2005 the competition began awarding the best student teams a $5,000.

By 2007, the competition had resulted in the formation of more than 50 new businesses by business students and alumni.

milestones.description: In 2010, Olin Cup marks the first year opening the competition to non-WashU student run enterprise in the St. Louis community.  LangLearner was selected as the Olin Cupâ€™s first-ever community winner and is qualified to seek funding from the Skandalaris
milestones.source_description: Olin Cup awards innovative ventures with $75,000
